Package edu.sjsu.View

Class HotelView

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
edu.sjsu.View.HotelView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class HotelView
extends javax.swing.JFrame
This class represents the view component of MVC. We have most of the logic of all the components that the user interacts with
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • HotelView

      public HotelView​(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> queue)
      constructor which takes the blocking queue and sets the frame for the view component
      Parameters:
      queue - - Blocking queue storing the messages needing to be executed

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static HotelView init​(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> queue)
      method to return a new object of HotelView using the blocking queue passed
      Parameters:
      queue - - Blocking queue storing the messages needing to be executed
      Returns:
      new HotelView object using the queue parameter

    • greeting

      public void greeting()
      greeting() method is the initial screen which prompts the user to either login or signup for a account. When the buttons are clicked, we add it as a message for the blocking queue so that we can process it

    • login

      public void login()
      login() method will check the credentials of the user and contains the GUI logic of the page as well. It will allow the user to go to the portal if they are authenticated

    • createAccount

      public void createAccount()
      createAccount() method contains the logic of creating a new account. It asks for a username and password with verification. Once you click submit, the action listener will add the credentials and the login page will work with the account.

    • guestHomepage

      public void guestHomepage​(User user)
      The main portal page for guests. Has actions to book a room, cancel reservation, and logout. The logic for these methods are explained later.
      Parameters:
      user - - current user that is logged in

    • bookRoom

      public void bookRoom​(java.util.ArrayList<Room> available, int monthB, int dayB, int yearB, int daysB, java.lang.String type2, User user) throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
      bookRoom contains the logic required to book a room according to the requirements passed by the user It will take in the preferences of the user and give all available rooms from which the user can select from. Once the user books this specific room, it is marked as unavailable and cannot be booked again for the same time frame.
      Parameters:
      available - - Uses the Room arraylist to check whether or not a given room is occupied or open to book
      monthB - - month selected
      dayB - - day selected
      yearB - - year selected
      daysB - - duration of visit
      type2 - - type of room selected
      user - - the logged in user
      Throws:
      java.lang.NumberFormatException

    • BookRoomConfirmation

      public void BookRoomConfirmation​(int month, int day, int year, int duration, Room room, User user, java.lang.String type)
      The BookRoomConfirmation acts as a confirmation page for users once they have selected the room It prints out the data, room type, and duration for the room that they have selected. Here we used GridBagLayout so that we can get all the elements aligned and placed properly on the frame. The user has the option to confirm (leads them back to thier portal), or cancel which will cancel the transaction and the user can book another room instead.
      Parameters:
      month - - selected month
      day - - selected day
      year - - selected year
      duration - - length of stay
      type - - type of room selected
      user - - user logged in

    • nullPopup

      public void nullPopup()

    • refreshStart

      public void refreshStart()
      acts a refresh page

    • refreshEnd

      public void refreshEnd()

    • loginFail

      public void loginFail()
